intro: Alphitonia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia alphitonia, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas.
